text: Sir Patrick William Eisdell Moore (17 March 1918 - 18 June 2015) was a New Zealand surgeon and medical researcher. He was known for his work with cochlear implants. He was the first person in the world to perform an eardrum transplant. Eisdell Moore was born in Bristol, Gloucestershire, England. He also as a medical officer during World War II. His autobiography So Old So Quick was released in 2004. He was married and had four children. Eisdell Moore died on 18 June 2015 in Orakei, Auckland. He was 97. ==References== Category:1918 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Autobiographers Category:Knights Bachelor Category:Medical researchers Category:Military personnel of World War II Category:Officers of the Order of the British Empire Category:People from Auckland Category:People from Bristol Category:New Zealand physicians
title: Patrick Eisdell Moore
